newsitem.title: USA: OSI sees wider than expected Q4 loss.
newsitem.headline: OSI sees wider than expected Q4 loss.

text.p: Objective Systems Integrators Inc said Monday it expects to report a wider than expected loss for its fourth quarter.

The company said in a statement it expects revenues for the quarter, ended June 30, will be lower than expected at about $5 million, with a net loss of about $14 million to $15.5 million, or between $0.43 a share and $0.47 a share.

Analysts had forecast the company would post a loss for the quarter of $0.16 a share, according to First Call. OSI reported profits of $2.4 million, or $0.07 a share, on revenues of $16 million in the comparable yaer-ago period.

OSI attributed the wider than expected loss to weaker revenues and charges. The company provided about $5 million of additional reserves for doubtful accounts, of which $2.5 million related to a single customer that is experiencing cash flow shortages. One-time charges of about $2 million were taken for a previously announced management restructuring.
